story.kicker_image_caption: The Mercedes Benz GLC is a luxury compact SUV.
story.storykicker: German luxury car manufacturer Mercedes-Benz has launched the GLC in India. The GLC is a luxury compact SUV that will take on the Audi Q5 and BMW X3.
story.storybody:
Mercedes-Benz is bringing a new model to India and it is called the GLC. The GLC is luxury compact SUV and it will be competing against the Audi Q5 and BMW X3 in the market. The prices for the luxury compact SUV which will replace the GLK model in the international markets start at Rs 50.7 lakh, ex-showroom Pune.

The GLC will be powered by a set of 2-litre petrol and diesel engines capable of putting out 245bhp and 370 Nm of peak torque and 170 bhp and 400 Nm of peak torque, respectively. Both the engines are mated to a nine-speed 9G-TRONIC automatic transmission. The petrol variant is called the GLC 300 while the diesel is called GLC 220d.

Also Read:  Mercedes Benz GLS 350d SUV launched for Rs 80.38 lakh

The diesel variant can sprint from 0-100 kmph in 8.3 seconds and go up to achieve a top speed of 210 kmph. The GLC 300 (petrol) variant  is quicker with a 0-100 kmph sprint time of just 6.5 seconds and a top speed of 222 kmph. The petrol variant can be a hot-seller in areas like NCR due to the ongoing ban on 2000 cc and bigger diesel engines by the NGT.

The GLC is based on the C-class sedan and if looked at very critically, it does resemble the sedan from the front. The all LED headlamps which come with integrated day time running lamps look smart and then there is the grille with the huge triple pointed star logo on it. In profile though the GLC comes with a toned down design and as a result looks more inclined towards a station wagon rather than a big SUV.

Also Read:  Mercedes Benz A-Class facelift has got the added chops

Inside the theme is all about luxury. The dash and other panels are leather clad and make the cabin look smart. There is a large infotainment panel atop the centre console which serves as a display for the satnav and audio among others. Space is found aplenty and seats are comfortable as well.

The GLC will be imported into the country as CBU (Completely Built units) and hence is called the Edition 1. The GLC measures 4,656 mm in length, 2,096 mm in width, 1,644 mm in height. The wheelbase is 2,874 mm long and the compact luxury SUV boasts a boot space of 550 litres, which is expandable up to 1,600 litres. The GLC received a five star rating in EURO NCAP ratings.

The Mercedes-Benz GLC 220d variant costs Rs 50.7 lakh, where as the GLC 300 variant will cost Rs 50.9 lakh. All prices are ex-showroom Pune.

Also Read:  Another new SUV joins the Mercedes-Benz India line-up
